titles.title: Fәtḥa nägäśt “Justice of the Kings” / Mäṣḥafä mәgbarat śännayt “Book of the Good Deeds” / Regulations for the sacerdotal ministers / Śәrʿatä betä krәstiyan wä-mäʿarәgatiha “Order of the Church and its Grades” / Täḫaśәśotat wä-sәʾǝlätat zä-ʾabäw wä-fәkkarehomu “Inquiries and Questions of the Fathers and their Responses” / Mäṣḥafä fäws mänfäsawi “Book of Spiritual Medicine”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Fәtḥa nägäśt “Justice of the Kings” (fols. 2ra-173vc) - Introduction (fols. 2ra-6vc) - Table of contents (fols. 6vb-7va) - Ecclesiastical laws (fols. 7va-76rc) - Civil laws (fols. 76va-170rc) - Law of Patriarch Cyril concerning land transaction (fols. 170rc-173vc) II) Mäṣḥafä mәgbarat śännayt “Book of the Good Works” (fols. 174ra-193rb) III) Regulations for the sacerdotal ministers (Zä-yәdällu ʾәm-śәrʿatä qәne mälʾәktä zä-kәhnät…) (fols. 193rb-196va) IV) Śәrʿatä betä krәstiyan wä-mäʿarәgatiha “Structure of the Church and its Grades” (fols. 196va-200rb) V) Täḫaśәśotat wä-sәʾǝlätat zä-ʾabäw wä-fәkkarehomu “Inquiries and Questions of the Fathers and their Responses” (fols. 200rb-207vb) VI) Mäṣḥafä fäws mänfäsawi “Book of Spiritual Medicine” (fols. 207vb-229rb)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The book belonged to ʾabeto ʾAbeselom, but was donated to Däbrä Dammo by his mother ʾƎlleni whose baptismal name was Wälättä Qal (s. Additio 1).

owners.owner: According to Additio 1, the former owner of the Ms. was ʾabeto ʾAbeselom.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 17th century (?). The embedded colophon of Text I (fol. 173va) provides an earlier date, but it was corrected: original dates were erased, other dates referring to the end of the 17th century were included, but the do not coincide. One of them refers to the second year of the reign of King ʾIyasu (ʾIyasu I, r. 1682-1706?).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with tooled reddish-brown leather. Overback made of tooled reddish-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (6 tools were used: double line fillet, double circles, two types of criss-cross, three line interlaced fillet, double sine wave with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: ፩I(9; s.l. 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – ፪II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – ፫III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – ፭V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – ፲X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 122r-129v) – ፲፯XVII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – ፲፰XVIII(8/fols. 138r-145v) – ፲፱XIX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – ፳XX(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXI(8/fols. 162r-169v) – XXII(4; s.l. 1, stub after 4; 2, stub after 4/fols. 170r-173v) – <XXIII(7; s.l. 7, no stub/fols. 174r-181v) – ፪XXIV(8/fols. 182r-189v) – ፫XXV(8/fols. 190r-197v) – ፬XXVI(8/fols. 198r-205v) – ፭XXVII(8/fols. 206r-213v) – ፮XXVIII(8/fols. 214r-221v) – ፯XXIX(9; s.l. 9, stub after 1/fols. 222r-230v)>

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: irregular but careful; hand b: fine.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: quires I-XXII (fols. 2ra-174vc). Hand b: quires XXIII-XXIX (fols. 175ra-229rc).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor; incipit of Text I and its sections; incipits of Texts II-VI; incipit of the articles in Text I; initial word of the sections of Texts III, V and VI; abbreviations referring to other works in Text I; numbers of the articles in Text I; numbers in the introduction, in the index and in the articles of Text I; words mәʿәraf “chapter” and kәfәl “section” in Text I; words ʾanqäṣ “section”, säʾәlät “question” and kәfәl “section” in Text II; directive to the ministers in Text II; abbreviations of the directives yәbәl kahәn “the priest says”, yәbәl diyaqon “the deacon says”, yәbәl ḥәzb “the people say” in Text II; numbering of the sections of Text V; words ḥatäta “question” and fәkkare “explanation” in Text V; the verbal form ʾәmbo “if there is…” in Text VI; Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs. On fols. 2r, 174r, a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

abbreviations.abbreviation: - Abbreviations and marks referring to other works in Text I: ጀ፡ for ወንጌል፡ ዕብ፡ for መልእክተ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ለዕብራውያን፡ ጤት፡ for መልእክተ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ትአ፡ for ኦሪት፡ ቀዳማዊ፡ ትቤ፡ for ኦሪት፡ ዳግማዊ፡ ትጋ፡ for ኦሪት፡ ሣልስ፡ ትዳ፡ for ኦሪት፡ ራብዕ፡ ትሔ፡ for ኦሪት፡ ኃምስ፡ ረስጠአ፡ for ቀሌምንጦስ፡ ቀዳማዊ፡ ረስጠብ፡ for ቀሌምንጦስ፡ ዳግማዊ፡ ረስጠጅ፡ for ቀሌምንጦስ፡ ሣልስ፡ ድስቅ፡ for ዲድስቅልያ፡ ጴጥ፡ for መልእክተ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ቀጠግ፡ for ቀኖና፡ በቅርጣግና፡ ግንር፡ for ቀኖና፡ በግንግራ፡ ጾክ፡ for ቀኖና፡ በአንጾኪያ፡ ኒቅ፡ for ቀኖና፡ በኒቅያ፡ ኒቅያ፡ for መለካውያን፡ ቀኖና፡ በኒቅያ፡ ዶቅ፡ for ቀኖና፡ በሎዶቅያ፡ ስድቅ፡ for ቀኖና፡ በስርድቅያ፡ በደስ፡ for ፲ወ፪ቱ፡ ቀኖና፡ ዘአብሉዲስ፡ በስ፡ for ፲ወ፫ቱ፡ ቀኖና፡ ዘባስልዮስ፡ ጠስ፡ for ቀኖና፡ ዘነገሥት፡ ተጥላሳት፡ መክ፡ for ቀኖና፡ ዘነገሥት፡ ዳግም፡ መጅ፡ for ቀኖና፡ ዘነገሥት፡ ሣልስ፡ መግ፡ for ቀኖና፡ ዘነገሥት፡ ራብዕ፡ ደ፡ for ትእምርት፡ ዘዲዮናስዮስ፡ ግር፡ for ትእምርት፡ ዘጎርጎርዮስ፡ ክርስጣ፡ for ትእምርት፡ ዘክርስቶዶሉ፡ ጢም፡ for ትእምርት፡ ዘጢሞቴዎስ፡ - Abbreviation of the directives in Text II: ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text I contains an embedded colophon. The original dates were erased, and other dates were inserted a secondary hand, referring to the end of the 17th century: 7162 ʿamätä ʿaläm “year of the world” (=1670 A.D.), 243 ʿamätä mәḥrät “year of mercy” (=1667 A.D.), 1666 ʿamätä śǝggawe “year of the Incarnation” (= 1673 A.D.), 1383 ʿamätä sämaʿtat “year of the martyrs” (=1667 A.D.), the second year of the reign of ʾIyasu (ʾIyasu I ?) (=1684 A.D.). The content of the Ms. is partly similar to Ms. BritLib Orient. 799 (WriBriMus 278, no. 365.3).

additional.det: The note mentions the name of the donor, ʾƎlleni “also called Wälättä Qal” (probably her baptismal name) who was the mother of prince (ʾabeto) ʾAbeselom and the wife of Nәwayä Maryam. The note tells that the donation was made upon the advice of ʾabunä Wäldä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ, probably a monk from the monastery (also mentioned in Mss. DD-005 and DD-035). The note mentions also that the donation was permitted by a certain däğğazmač Bәrru.

additional.cont: Fol. 230v: Record concerning reconciliation between Christians and Muslims.
additional.det: In Amharic, by another hand. The note was written during the time of King Mәnilәk II (r. 1889-1913) and the tenure of the abbot Kidänä Maryam.

extras.extra: - The title Sәnkәssar is crudely written on fol. 1r. - The internal number of the monastic library (444) is written on fol. 1r. - Amharic commentaries written in smaller script in the upper margins and in the intercolumns in Text I.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire marks on the first folio of quires II-XX and XXIV-XXIX; quire mark on the second folio of quire I.
